text: If your onions look like they're on the struggle bus, it might be pests or diseases. Let's fix that. Onion thrips, onion flies, cutworms, armyworms, aphids, spider mites and root knot nematodes. These pests are out to ruin your onions. Thrips cause silver streaks, flies larvae, rot bulbs and cutworms, chop plants. Armyworms defoliate, aphids spread viruses, mites create webs and nematodes form root galls. For diseases Downy Mildew loves humidity. White rot causes bulb rot, neck rot ruins storage onions, fusarium basal rot yellows leaves and botrytis leaf. Blight spots leaves. To control them use neem oil for pests, rotate crops and keep fields clean. For diseases ensure good drainage avoid overhead watering and use resistant varieties. Keep your onions happy and healthy. Don't forget to subscribe for more gardening tips.
